channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Lebanese authorities were repeatedly warned about danger of hazardous chemicals
item.description: Lebanon has placed every official who was responsible for port security in Beirut for the last six years under house arrest as it investigates an explosion which has devastated the city.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Wedding photos interrupted by massive blast
item.description: Cameraman Mahmoud Nakib had been in a quiet square of the city to film drone footage of the bride (pictured) when the explosion rocked the Lebanese capital last night.

item.title: Dutch rider Fabio Jakobsen left in 'life-threatening condition' after horror crash
item.description: Dutch cyclist Jakobsen - had raced into the final metres of the race elbow-to-elbow with compatriot Dylan Groenewegen but then suffered what doctors have now confirmed to be life-threatening injuries.

item.title: YouTube star Jake Paul's LA home raided by FBI after big party
item.description: FBI agents raided YouTube star Jake Paul's Calabasas home early Wednesday morning, TMZ reported. Authorities said they did not plan to make arrests but could not comment on the search,

item.title: UK offers £5m aid to Lebanon as 'rigorous' probe promised
item.description: The Foreign Secretary spoke to Lebanon's prime minister Hassan Diab today to set out what support the UK could offer the country which has been plunged into a state of emergency.

item.title: A83 landslide: 6,000 tons of mud and rock crash down 650ft hill
item.description: A heavy landslide hit the A83 at the Rest and Be Thankful in Argyll, Scotland, after nearly four inches of rainfall in the region yesterday. The road bas been closed for the second time this year.

item.title: Beirut blast survivors sift rubble for bodies as death toll continues to rise
item.description: Satellite images show the port warehouse where the explosion that devastated Beirut was located has been reduced to nothing more than a watery crater, while nearby buildings have been flattened.

item.title: Moment small girl is found alive after spending 24 HOURS under the rubble
item.description: As a frantic hunt for missing people continued in the Lebanese capital tonight, footage emerged of rescue workers finding the child lodged between debris.

item.title: US will pay Johnson & Johnson $1billion in exchange for 100 million coronavirus vaccine doses
item.description: The latest contract is priced at roughly $10 per Johnson & Johnson coronavirus vaccine dose in comparison with the $19.50 the US is paying Pfizer Inc for its COVID-19 jab.

item.title: Instagram model defends decision not to wear mask on Tube
item.description: The model filmed a man confronting her in a foul-mouthed tirade on the platform at Tottenham Court Road station on the London Underground on Sunday.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Tel Aviv city hall lights up as Lebanese flag
item.description: Israel's latest gesture, following an offer of humanitarian aid hours after the blast yesterday afternoon, is surprising given that the countries are technically at war.

item.title: Colombia Supreme Court places former President Uribe...
item.description: Alvaro Uribe became the first former president in Colombia to be detained after the Supreme Court placed him under house arrest Tuesday as part of a fraud and witness tampering investigation.

item.title: 'Black widow' who drugged and robbed businessmen arrested
item.description: Sabrina Cynthia Novillo is one of four females, including a 17-year-old, arrested for drugging and robbing several wealthy men in Argentina from 2018 to 2020.

item.title: Lewis Burton seen on day of Caroline Flack suicide inquest
item.description: Lewis Burton was seen leaving rumoured girlfriend Lottie Tomlinson's London property on Wednesday - the same day an inquest took place concerning the suicide of his ex Caroline Flack.

item.title: Couple flee from car after hitting woman and dog in hit-and-run
item.description: WARNING: DISTRESSING CONTENT: The woman had been taking her dog Millie for a walk in Great Barr, Birmingham, when she was hit by the Renault Clio on July 22.

item.title: Mayor of Luton stands down due to Covid-19 breach
item.description: Mayor of Luton Tahir Malik has stood down from his office after he was photographed attending a party which took place while the area was on lockdown.

item.title: Andrew Cuomo begs people to return to New York to save city
item.description: Thousands of New York City residents fled Manhattan and Brooklyn earlier this year when the city was the COVID-19 epicenter of the world.

item.title: Thousands of new cars are prepared for dealers
item.description: Thousands of new cars have been parked at the Rockingham Motor Speedway in Corby, Northamptonshire ahead of their delivery to dealerships around the country.

item.title: Kate Middleton and Prince William visit Gavin & Stacey arcade
item.description: Kate Middleton and Prince William (pictured), both 38, cut stylish figures as they paid a secret visit to the iconic 'Nessa's' arcade in Barry Island on Wednesday.

item.title: Second wave strikes Europe: Spain reintroduces lockdown, Greece sees a worrying rise in cases
item.description: A second wave of coronavirus has struck Europe as Spain reimposes lockdowns, cases spike in Greece and French officials warn they could lose control at any moment.

item.title: Sicilian Mafia could be dismantled via social network analysis
item.description: Experts from the UK and Italy used data gathered by law enforcement on a real-life Mafia syndicate to test different ways of identifying the most crucial members.

item.title: UK Weather: Tomorrow 82F and muggy before 96F on Friday
item.description: Brits are expected to enjoy highs of 82F (28C) tomorrow before temperatures rise dramatically closer to the weekend. Pictured, a youngster jumps into the sea in Hastings.

item.title: Privilege backlash as Silicon Valley investor starts 'microschool'
item.description: Wealthy Silicon Valley angel investor Jason Calacanis, 49, is facing backlash for posting a Twitter ad looking for teacher to start microschool in his backyard.

item.title: Microbes beneath the seafloor found living on fifty-billion-billion times less energy than a human'
item.description: An international team of researchers led by Queen Mary University of London used data from the sub-seafloor to create a new global picture of the ocean biosphere.

item.title: Queen sends 'thoughts and prayers' to victims of Beirut port explosion
item.description: In a message of solidarity with the people of Lebanon, Her Majesty wrote 'our thoughts and prayers are with the families and friends of those who have been injured or lost their lives'.

item.title: Fury as Altrincham and Hale included in Manchester lockdown
item.description: A major incident was declared by authorities in the metropolitan county this week following a rise in the number of coronavirus infections, and with it came a debate over geographical boundaries.

item.title: Coronavirus: Italy threatens to suspend Ryanair's right to fly
item.description: Italy accused the Irish low-cost airline of 'repeated violations of the COVID-19 health regulations currently in force and imposed by the Italian government to protect the health of passengers'.

item.title: Over a million live in subterranean Cold War tunnels in China
item.description: The underground city, dubbed 'The Dungeon', was constructed in 1969 when the threat of nuclear war was at its peak.

item.title: Boy, 14, who died after eating popcorn at cinema, forgot EpiPen
item.description: Ruben Bousquet died after eating sweet popcorn while watching a film with his parents at an Odeon Cinema in London on April 18, 2018.

item.title: Aberdeen is put into lockdown: Nicola Sturgeon orders all pubs in the city to close
item.description: Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said the restrictions were brought back after 54 new coronavirus cases emerged after bars were packed over the weekend.

item.title: Classic hot hatches become hot property as old boy racers buy them up
item.description: Ageing boy racers have moved from the McDonalds car parks of their heyday to auction houses to get their hands on hot hatches that take them back to their youth.

item.title: Caroline Flack's final message revealed as inquest resumes
item.description: Today the Love Island presenter's mother and twin sister are among those watching proceedings virtually from Poplar Coroner's Court, with a coroner in the court.

item.title: The best electric cars you can buy for any budget revealed
item.description: The best electrified models have been chosen by What Car? as part of its unique honours list. Here are the 16 winners...

item.title: Samsung unveils Galaxy Note 20 and Note 20 Ultra smartphones
item.description: Designed for 'Note loyalists', the standard Note 20 and Note 20 Ultra will both support 5G and stream Xbox games over the cloud.

item.title: Brain-computer interfaces like Elon Musk's Neuralink at risk
item.description: Elon Musk's startup Neuralink could have a prototype ready this year, but a new report warns brain-computer interfaces could open a window for hackers to read our thoughts and memories.

item.title: Flamingo Land worker is seriously hurt after getting leg 'trapped under rollercoaster'
item.description: A man has been rushed to hospital by air ambulance after being seriously hurt 'working on a rollercoaster' at theme park Flamingo Land. Yorkshire Ambulance Service were called to the scene.

item.title: Man, 20, found guilty of rape and murder of barmaid friend
item.description: Wesley Streete has been found guilty at Stafford Crown Court of the 2019 rape and murder of his childhood friend Keeley Bunker, who had 'trusted' the killer to walk her home safe, in Staffordshire.

item.title: Around one in 20 people in England who were shielding won't go back to work by the end of the year
item.description: Official figures show some six per cent of those classed as clinically extremely vulnerable in England were not intending to return to their job in the next four months.

item.title: Heat could kill more than HIV, malaria and yellow fever by 2100
item.description: Experts warn hat if greenhouse gas emissions are not curbed, heatwaves could kill 73 people per 100,000 by 2100. The number of fatalities is more than HIV, malaria and yellow fever combined.

item.title: Woman revives a 'dead' field mouse found lying in her garden
item.description: Becky Ramsey was at her home in North Wales when she noticed the motionless field mouse lying in her garden and decided to carry out compressions to try to revive it.

item.title: Finland is to reintroduce remote working as cases rise
item.description: Finland plans to reintroduce a working from home whenever possible just days after dropping it, due to a rise in COVID-19 cases, the minister in charge of managing the epidemic said Wednesday.

item.title: Novavax coronavirus vaccine produced higher levels of antibodies than seen in recovered patients
item.description: Early results from a clinical trial by Maryland-based company Novavax said two doses of its vaccine produced higher levels of coronavirus antibodies than those seen in recovered patients.

item.title: Ellen DeGeneres' brother Vance defends the talk show host
item.description: Vance DeGeneres, 65, said that Ellen, 62, is being 'viciously attacked' amid her toxic workplace scandal, which he decried as being 'all bulls***.'

item.title: Photos show hypnotic beauty of Canada's Banff National Park
item.description: They were snapped by Vancouver-based photographer Kai Yhun, who visits Banff National Park several times each year to capture its wanderlust-inducing qualities.

item.title: Britain records 892 more coronavirus cases and 65 deaths
item.description: Department of Health bosses say 820 Britons are now being struck down with the life-threatening virus every day, on average. The rate has been rising since dropping to 546 on July 8.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's creepy birthday poem to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell asked friend Christopher Mason to write a creepy poem about a '24-hour erections' and 'schoolgirl crush' for Jeffrey Epstein's 40th birthday.

item.title: Chinese woman's belly grows to 44lbs due to mystery condition
item.description: The 36-year-old mother from rural China has made a desperate plea for help through local media after the enormous growth made it impossible for her to sleep, walk or look after her son and daughter.

item.title: UK pharmacies could be BANNED from selling codeine
item.description: Codeine is a highly-addictive painkiller. The Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) is considering making all opioid painkillers prescription-only.

item.title: Ministers reject demands from unions for face masks to be worn in schools
item.description: Unions have urged the government to reconsider guidance that face covering are not required as staff and pupils are meeting in regular groups.

item.title: How to hide private photos on your iPhone in three easy steps
item.description: There is an easy way to hide your private photos on an Apple iPhone thanks to a little-known setting in the camera roll.

item.title: Caroline Flack's tearful mother blasts CPS over 'show trial'
item.description: Flack had been due to stand trial for assaulting her boyfriend, former tennis player and model Lewis Burton, at a house in London in December.

item.title: Cambridge, Milton Keynes and Tees Valley towns will be first to trial e-scooter rental scheme
item.description: Around 50 local authorities are thought to be eyeing up a government scheme to make e-scooters legal on Britain's roads. Milton Keynes and towns in the Tees Valley have ordered hundreds of the vehicles.

item.title: Prince William and Kate Middleton face bingo-calling critic, 87
item.description: William and Kate were visiting Shire Hall Care Home in Cardiff today, three months after speaking to staff and residents via video link and calling out Bingo numbers.

item.title: £170k Aston Martin DBS abandoned in 1979 discovered in barn
item.description: The dilapidated Aston Martin DBS, built in 1971, was discovered in an old barn near Bridgnorth, Shropshire, with just over 60,000 miles on the clock.

item.title: Neighbours of £195,000 house that plunged off cliff are told council 'will do nothing' to save them
item.description: Families in an Eastchurch community where a house plunged off the edge of a cliff have been warned they are in danger. One blasted their local council, adding is was 'not even going to touch the cliff'

item.title: Jupiter's huge storms caused by water and ammonia 'mushballs'
item.description: Images from NASA's Juno mission have revealed large, rotating white clouds of ammonia covering more than 2,000 square miles of the planet's upper atmosphere.

item.title: Surfers Paradise on the Gold Coast is deserted during the lunch hour because of coronavirus
item.description: Surfers Paradise was deserted during the lunch hour on Tuesday with the 'glitter strip' now awash with 'for lease' signs, even though Queensland isn't in lockdown.
item.media:credit: Andrew Carlile for Daily Mail Australia

item.title: Teacher sacked over behaviour with dads reunites with husband
item.description: A primary school teacher sacked over a sexual fling with a pupil's father and a string of 'inappropriate relationships' with other dads is back with her husband, who says they are happily married

item.title: Coronavirus: WHO urges young people to help control spread
item.description: It is thought that younger generations have been contributing to recent resurgences of Covid-19. The proportion of those infected aged 15-24 has risen three-fold in just five months, WHO data shows.

item.title: MP who quit as minister over Dom Cummings' lockdown trip to Durham crowned new Scots Tory leader
item.description: The 37-year-old former Champions League linesman and referee, won after running unopposed for the post vacated by Jackson Carlaw last Thursday.

item.title: aoiseach Micheal Martin is among politicians and family at funeral of ex-SDLP leader John Hume
item.description: The Derry politician, feted around the world as a peacemaker, died on Monday at the age of 83 after a long battle with dementia.

item.title: How to Lose A Stone in 21 Days: Diabetes spurs on teacher, 34
item.description: Katie Holmes, 34, appears on tonight's episode of Channel 4's How to Lose A Stone in 21 Days, with Dr Michael Mosley telling the young mother she is prediabetic at his clinic in Buckinghamshire.

item.title: Tuatara 'lizard' genome sequence is 'half-mammal, half-reptile'
item.description: Scientists from the University of Adelaide and South Australian Museum worked with Otago University, New Zealand to study the rare tuatara and its genetic makeup.

item.title: Teenage boy runs into M5 traffic and is hit by 'multiple vehicles'
item.description: A teenage boy, 15, is fighting for his life after being hit by 'multiple vehicles after running into oncoming traffic on the M5 near the Oldbury interchange.

item.title: Now a £200million superyacht joins the staycation crowds in Cornwall
item.description: The billionaire financier's £91million, 243ft expedition ship was dwarfed by the Emir's £200million, 410ft monster as they docked near the 644ft cruise liner The World.

item.title: Kate Middleton shows off new sun-kissed highlights at baby bank
item.description: Celebrity stylist James Johnson told FEMAIL the Duchess of Cambridge, 38, had perfected subtly changing her hair and said the lighter sunkissed look was 'more fresh' and 'youthful'.

item.title: London teenagers deny murdering talented footballer, 19, after he was 'attacked with a Samurai sword
item.description: Francois Kablan (pictured), 19, from Bermondsey, south-east London, was allegedly attacked following a confrontation with two males armed with weapons.

item.title: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? player uses ALL FOUR lifelines on Spice Girls question
item.description: Paul Curievici, from Surrey, was asked to name Spice Girls' second UK number one single to win £64,000, but had to use up all four of his lifelines before getting the correct answer.

item.title: Golden retriever tries to fetch a ball but is scared of the ocean
item.description: Footage captured by Allissa Crea, 32, from New York, shows her two-year-old golden retriever Hudson struggle to fetch his ball as the waves splash onto the sand at Long Beach Island.

item.title: Gallery releases image of young Kate Moss in 1990 which was REJECTED for not being 'glamazon' enough
item.description: The black and white photograph, taken by singer-turned-photographer Kate Garner in 1990, shows the model aged around 16 sat at a dressing table on the telephone.

item.title: Lookalike mother and daughter Dawn Hubsher (60) and Cher Hubsher (30) stun
item.description: Authors Dawn Hubsher, 60, and Cher Hubsher, 30, from Florida and New York respectively, may look like twin sisters, however the two are in fact mother and daughter.

item.title: Can YOU spot the holidaymaker eating an ice cream in the sun?
item.description: As Britons debate between jetting abroad this summer and embracing a staycation, a holiday-themed brainteaser has been designed to conjure up thoughts of a sunny, escape to the beach.

item.title: Girl, 6, chokes on 'FACE MASK she found inside her McDonald's chicken nuggets'
item.description: Laura Arber said she made the discovery in at least two of the 20 nuggets she had bought for daughter Maddie and her children from the fast food branch in Aldershot, Hampshire, yesterday.

item.title: Sir Bob Geldof submits plans for Monet-inspired wildlife pond
item.description: The former rockstar has submitted proposals to the local authority to create a 40m pool to attract wildlife at Davington Priory (pictured), the 68-year-old's long-term home in Kent.

item.title: Changing farming methods 'may reduce risk of infectious disease outbreaks'
item.description: Global land use change is creating increasing opportunities for contact between people and potential hosts of human disease, scientists warn.

item.title: PC Andrew Harper's widow calls for full life jail terms for killers
item.description: The grieving widow of hero officer PC Andrew Harper has launched a campaign for full life jail terms for the killers of emergency services workers. Lissie Harper said she would 'never stop' to get justice

item.title: Denmark's Prince Joachim leaves hospital after brain surgery
item.description: The son of Queen Margrethe of Denmark, who is sixth in line to the throne, has been released from hospital in Toulouse after spending the weekend in intensive care with his wife by his side.

item.title: Charity warns of an 'alarming' drop in number of over-65s getting diagnosed with dementia
item.description: NHS data shows almost 30,000 fewer over-65s in England thought to have Alzheimer's disease were listed as being a sufferer in June compared to February.

item.title: Pubs COULD be forced to close to offset reopening of schools, says Neil Ferguson
item.description: Neil Ferguson - known as 'Professor Lockdown' for his role in modelling the impact of the disease - said the 'R' rate could rise by as much as half when all pupils come back next month.

item.title: Moment waste removal men dump a truckload of rubbish over customer's driveway
item.description: Jonathan Morgan, 31, and his brother Calum, 27, claim the customer refused to pay up after they spent two hours clearing the mess outside her property in Cardiff, Wales.

item.title: North Korea: Officials probe whether explosion victims tried to save Kim portraits
item.description: The first officials on the scene immediately inquired whether any households had rescued portraits of Kim Il-sung, the 'Great Leader' and founder of the nation, and 'Dear Leader' Kim Jong-il.

item.title: Identities of Meghan Markle's friends will remain secret, judge rules
item.description: The five women were named as the sources of a People magazine article in 2019 in legal papers submitted by Meghan to the High Court in London, although their identities were not made public.

item.title: Maid rushes to protect little girl from shattering windows as massive explosion rips through Beirut
item.description: The unnamed woman was watching over the toddler in the Lebanese capital of Beirut when the blast hit. She quickly scooped the little girl off the floor as windows shattered around them.

item.title: Missguided is accused of hypocrisy for 'supporting BLM while stealing swimsuit from black designer'
item.description: Critics slammed the British brand for hypocrisy, stating it claims to stand for 'diversity' while appearing to have copied the work of Desintationswimwear's black owner, Racquel Simone, from New York.

item.title: Keir Starmer warns PM has a MONTH to fix the NHS test and trace system
item.description: Labour leader Keir Starmer lashed the PM for being 'too slow to act' throughout the crisis, saying he needed to accept the crucial tracking arrangements are not working properly.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Preston set to be next city in local lockdown
item.description: More than 34 people per 100,000 were diagnosed with Covid-19 in the Lancashire city in the week ending July 30, compared to little over 13 per 100,000 the week prior.

item.title: Disinherited daughter faces losing her home in legal battle with RNLI
item.description: Sonya Young won the whole of her £260,000 Welsh home in her divorce earlier this year, but now faces selling it after a judge this week imposed charging orders.

item.title: Sadiq Khan demands to know Boris Johnson's coronavirus 'game plan'
item.description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan complained that he had been shut out of Cobra crisis meetings and snubbed by the PM since mid-May.

item.title: P&O ferry spots dinghy bringing 15 more migrants to Dover
item.description: Another boatload of migrants has today arrived in Dover after a dinghy was 'spotted in the English Channel by a P&O ferry'. The migrants were seen being guided off a lifeboat at the Kent port town.

item.title: Baby born with umbilical cord wrapped around neck SIX TIMES
item.description: The child, billed by doctors as a 'miracle baby', was delivered naturally last week and weighed just over three kilograms (6.6 pounds) at birth, according to a hospital in Hubei Province, China.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Office blown apart during live BBC interview
item.description: Maryam Toumi had been conducting an interview with Faisal Al-Asil, director of projects at the Moroccan Agency for Sustainable Energy, when the blast hit the Lebanese capital yesterday.

item.title: BBC defends showing same-sex kiss on CBBC's The Next Step
item.description: The broadcaster issued a lengthy statement on their website where they defended their decision and insisted LGBTQ+ young people should be represented.

item.title: £9.25m Paper Tycoon's Mansion For Sale in Westminster
item.description: Located moments from London's Parliament Square, 20 Old Queen Street was originally built in 1909 as the family home of the paper mill tycoon Henry G. Spicer, who died in 1939.

item.title: How deadly is Covid-19? Italian study finds mortality rate is 7.4% while Qatari study says 0.01%
item.description: Estimation of the fatality rate of Covid-19 range between 0.01 per cent and 1.4 per cent. The World Health Organization said their best guess was that the coronavirus kills 0.6 per cent of cases.

item.title: Doctors warn of spike in short-sightedness caused by staring at screens to relieve boredom
item.description: Eye specialists from Singapore, Germany and Tokyo found that increased digital screen time is associated with the onset of myopia (short-sightedness).

item.title: Russia's worst-ever serial killer wishes he had been executed
item.description: Former policeman Mikhail Popkov, 56, is currently serving a life sentence at a penal colony in Mordovia. The father-of-one recently admitted he had 'a lot to regret' over his reign of terror.

item.title: WH Smith could axe 1,500 staff due to plunge in customers during pandemic
item.description: The retailer said today the proposals will cost the company between £15 million and £19 million, after group revenues were down 57 per cent in July compared with the same month last year.

item.title: Lockdown HAS affected babies' development and behaviour, research shows
item.description: The Babies In Lockdown report, commissioned by three leading UK children and parents advocacy groups, found new parents felt 'abandoned' by the lack of care available during lockdown.

item.title: Obese woman sheds 12 stone after ditching her toxic ex
item.description: Alisa Elizabeth Dreyer, from Sydney, 27, went from weighing 145.1kg to 68kg (10st 8lbs) thanks to ditching her junk food diet of up to 5,000 calories a day in favour of veganism and exercise.

item.title: Spain's former King Juan Carlos, 82, says his self-imposed exile is 'only temporary'
item.description: Former king Juan Carlos's sudden exit is only temporary, he told friends from aboard a jet carrying him away from Spain, local media reported today, as confusion mounted over the ex-monarch's plans.

item.title: GPs cannot refuse to treat patients who refuse to wear a face covering
item.description: NHS England has told doctors that patients 'should not be refused entry to a premises or access to care if they are unable to or refuse to' wear a face mask.

item.title: Married, divorced and widowed women being urged to check if they are being underpaid state pension
item.description: Married, divorced and widowed women are the three groups who may have been affected by the pension mishap - which has already led the Department of Pensions to pay out £750,000.

item.title: Leading clinic reports a link between Covid-19 symptoms and rise in hair loss patients
item.description: Specialists at the Belgravia Centre in London told FEMAIL they began noticing an uplift in cases of telogen effluvium - a shedding condition - in patients who battled coronavirus.

item.title: UK's crucial services sector FINALLY returns to growth
item.description: The closely-watched PMI index recorded a level above 50 - representing expansion - last month for the first time since February.

item.title: Hapless fiance, 26, set fire to flat when he spelt out 'Marry Me' using tea lights in proposal
item.description: In a grand but ultimately ill-fated gesture, Albert Ndreu, 26, arranged 100 mini-candles on the floor of his flat in Sheffield, South Yorks, so he could pop the question to his girlfriend Valerija Madevic.

item.title: More British workers are staying at home than in any other major European nations
item.description: Little more than a third (34 per cent) of UK staff are back at their desk, compared with 83 per cent of French office staff and 70 per cent of Germans.

item.title: Ammonium nitrate was at the heart of the massive Beirut explosion
item.description: Ammonium nitrate is an odourless crystalline substance that is naturally stable and used in fertilisers, but when mixed with other chemicals such as oil can create a potent explosive.

item.title: Girl, two, dies after 'assault and neglect' sparking arrest of two people
item.description: Dan Thomas said he would seek 'justice,' following the death of his two-year-old daughter Lola James from Haverfordwest, Pembrokeshire.
item.media:description: Two-year-old Lola James died in hospital days after police were called to an incident at an address in Haverfordwest, Pembrokeshire (Dyfed-Powys Police/PA)

item.title: Kate Middleton ditches her wedges for trend-led new look with white trainers and cool headband
item.description: Kate Middleton, 38, opted for a cool off-duty look as she donned a £112 green Boden shirt dress, white Superga trainers and a cool £59 headband for a visit to Baby Basics in West Norfolk in May.

item.title: Prince Andrew dons sunglasses as he emerges from Windsor after Spitting Image puppet claims
item.description: Prince Andrew was seen driving himself from his residence at Royal Lodge, Windsor, as the shocking documents were revealed, which include the stunning accusations from Virginia Roberts.

item.title: Shocking new erotic drama Little Birds sees dominatrix urinate on client
item.description: Controversial author Anaïs Nin wrote a series of short series which have been adapted by Sky Atlantic into Little Birds, a six-part series which follows a host of characters through life in Tangier in the 1950s.

item.title: Videos capture the moment the explosion in Beirut tore the city apart
item.description: A series of videos captured the devastation in Beirut as an explosion tore through the Lebanese capital, killing at least 100 people dead and injuring more than 4,000.

item.title: Couple who dress in vintage clothes fell in love
item.description: Richard Herfeld, 29, and Steffi Kay, 26, of Toronto, dress almost exclusively in original outfits from the 1920s and 1930s. They also have a shared love of music from the period.

item.title: How civil war, economic woes and an explosion heaps further woe on Beirut
item.description: Rescuers searched for survivors in Beirut yesterday after a cataclysmic explosion at the port sowed devastation across entire neighbourhoods, killing more than 100 people.

item.title: White Island volcano survivor who suffered burns to 70 per cent of her body reveals her injuries
item.description: Stephanie Browitt, 23, is still on the long road to recovery after the December 2019 eruption off the east of New Zealand that claimed the lives of her sister and father. .

item.title: Mother, 26, spat in policeman's face and shouted racist abuse at him
item.description: Dina Carlsson, 26, spat at at PC Shahid Ahmed and called him racist names after officers were called out to her home in Middlesborough in April this year.

item.title: Former Ellen DeGeneres Show producer Hedda Muskat makes shocking claims about the embattled host
item.description: A former producer of The Ellen DeGeneres Show has come out and made some shocking claims about the embattled TV host, 62.

item.title: Haunting snaps inside abandoned prison that once housed Fred West
item.description: Eerie pictures of Gloucester have shown the decaying remains of the men's prison, which once housed notorious serial killer Fred West, seven years after it shut for good in 2013.

item.title: Teenage thug who stamped on man's head in unprovoked attack is jailed for more than seven years
item.description: Robin Foster, 19, asked his victim for a cigarette in Oldbury, West Midlands, last August before punching him. When the victim fled, he chased him for a mile to a Shell garage and stamped on his head.

item.title: William Hill shutting 119 stores for good post-lockdown
item.description: The closures will leave the betting firm with 1,414 stores across the UK. William Hill has not yet revealed the location of the 119 sites staying shut.

item.title: Prince Harry hates that William is the sensible one
item.description: Royal commentator and journalist Duncan Larcombe told OK! how he met Harry, now 35, for a drink in 2008 after the results of the inquest into the death of his mother, were published.

item.title: Ruff and tumble! Labrador refuses to cut puppy any slack in tug-of-war over a sock
item.description: The Labrador Retriever decided to go head-to-head with the small puppy and pulled the sock from its teeth in a game of tug-of-war at a home in Lynchburg, Virginia,

item.title: Dementia risk falls for millions as chance of developing the disease is now 13% lower than 2010
item.description: Harvard University researchers found the risk of developing the incurable disorder has plummeted by a huge 24 per cent for men since 1988. Women have seen a more gradual decline (8 per cent).

item.title: Queen dons her favourite gold stag brooch as she and Prince Philip arrive at Balmoral
item.description: The Queen celebrated the natural beauty of the Scottish Highlands by donning a gold stag brooch ahead of her arrival at Balmoral, in Aberdeenshire, yesterday.

item.title: Hilarious snaps capture the people who are having the WORST day ever
item.description: Shareably has rounded up a selection of viral snaps of people from across the globe having a bad day - including one person who ruined the interior of their car with buckets of paint that spilled in transit.

item.title: Mum-of-four feeds entire family for £3.09 a week using an anti-food waste app
item.description: Kathryn Neale, 37, from Wellingborough, has revealed how she feeds her entire family for just £3.09 a week using the Morrisons Too Good To Go app and Olio where people give away surplus food.

item.title: Model cures her acne with dermatologist help and signature products
item.description: An Australian model who had to stop working earlier this year because of her acne has shared the products and dermatologist advice she followed to clear up her skin for good.

item.title: Woman's botched manicure is hailed as a lesson to skip beauty treatments during COVID-19
item.description: The nail lover requested a short, round burgundy set with a nude triangle inverted over each cuticle bed, but left the salon with unevenly shaped talons decorated with crudely drawn hearts.
